[ { "id":"CustomersFilePattern", "name":"Customers file name pattern (for example \"^[\\w\\-]{1,}\\.xml$\"(*.xml))", "type":"string", "mandatory":true }, { "id":"ImportMode", "name":"Import Mode", "type":"enum", "enumValues":[ "MERGE", "REPLACE", "UPDATE", "DELETE" ], "mandatory":true }, { "id":"archiveFiles", "name":"Put processed files into archive folder", "type":"enum", "enumValues":[ "DELETE", "KEEP", "MOVE_TO_ARCHIVE" ], "mandatory":true }, { "id":"archivePrefix", "name":"Archive Folder Prefix", "type":"enum", "enumValues":[ "-", "IMPEX" ], "mandatory":false }, { "id":"archiveFolder", "name":"Archive folder for processed files(default ./archive relative to Input Folder)", "type":"string", "mandatory":false } ]

You can define a date which must be before or after the current time (the time of execution) to continue. If before is chosen and the current time is after the defined date, the component will exit with an error. If after is chosen and the date is not reached yet, the component is suspended until it is reached.

You can define a date with time which must be before or after the current time (the time of execution) to continue. If before is chosen and the current time is after the defined value, the component will exit with an error. If after is chosen and the time is not reached yet, the component is suspended until it is reached.

Rebuilds the indexes that are configured

You can define a time which must be before or after the current time (the time of execution) to continue. If before is chosen and the current time is after the defined time, the component will exit with an error. If after is chosen and the time is not reached yet, the component is suspended until it is reached. Important note: Do not define times near the day change, e.g. 23.59 (for after) or 00.01 (for before), this can lead to never ending workflows! Better is something like 23.00, but this also depends on the number of DW jobs for executing the workflows.
